00010 /* Determine if two vectors have the 'same' name. */
00011 
00012 static bool
00013 nameeq(char *n1, char *n2)
00014 {
00015     char buf1[BSIZE_SP], buf2[BSIZE_SP];
00016     
00017     int i;
00018 
00019     if (eq(n1, n2))
00020         return (TRUE);
00021     if (isdigit(*n1))
00022         (void) sprintf(buf1, "v(%s)", n1);
00023     else
00024         (void) strcpy(buf1, n1);
00025     if (isdigit(*n2))
00026         (void) sprintf(buf2, "v(%s)", n2);
00027     else
00028         (void) strcpy(buf2, n2);
00029     for (i = 0; buf1[i]; i++)
00030         if (isupper(buf1[i]))
00031             buf1[i] = tolower(buf1[i]);
00032     for (i = 0; buf2[i]; i++)
00033         if (isupper(buf2[i]))
00034             buf2[i] = tolower(buf2[i]);
00035     return (eq(buf1, buf2) ? TRUE : FALSE);
00036 }
00037 
00038 void
00039 com_diff(wordlist *wl)
00040 {
00041     double vntol, abstol, reltol, tol, cmax, cm1, cm2;
00042     struct plot *p1, *p2 = NULL;
00043     struct dvec *v1, *v2;
00044     double d1, d2;
00045     complex c1, c2, c3;
00046     int i, j;
00047     wordlist *tw;
00048     char numbuf[BSIZE_SP],numbuf2[BSIZE_SP] ,numbuf3[BSIZE_SP], numbuf4[BSIZE_SP]; /* For printnum */
00049 
00050     if (!cp_getvar("diff_vntol", VT_REAL, (char *) &vntol))
00051         vntol = 1.0e-6;
00052     if (!cp_getvar("diff_abstol", VT_REAL, (char *) &abstol))
00053         abstol = 1.0e-12;
00054     if (!cp_getvar("diff_reltol", VT_REAL, (char *) &reltol))
00055         reltol = 0.001;
00056 
00057     /* Let's try to be clever about defaults. This code is ugly. */
00058     if (!wl || !wl->wl_next) {
00059         if (plot_list && plot_list->pl_next &&
00060                 !plot_list->pl_next->pl_next) {
00061             p1 = plot_list;
00062             p2 = plot_list->pl_next;
00063             if (wl && !eq(wl->wl_word, p1->pl_typename) &&
00064                     !eq(wl->wl_word, p2->pl_typename)) {
00065                 fprintf(cp_err, "Error: no such plot \"%s\"\n",
00066                         wl->wl_word);
00067                 return;
00068             }
00069             fprintf(cp_err, "Plots are \"%s\" and \"%s\"\n",
00070                     plot_list->pl_typename,
00071                     plot_list->pl_next->pl_typename);
00072             if (wl)
00073                 wl = NULL;
00074         } else {
00075             fprintf(cp_err, "Error: plot names not given.\n");
00076             return;
00077         }
00078     } else {
00079         for (p1 = plot_list; p1; p1 = p1->pl_next)
00080             if (eq(wl->wl_word, p1->pl_typename))
00081                 break;
00082         if (!p1) {
00083             fprintf(cp_err, "Error: no such plot %s\n", 
00084                     wl->wl_word);
00085             return;
00086         }
00087         wl = wl->wl_next;
00088     }
00089 
00090     if (!p2) {
00091         for (p2 = plot_list; p2; p2 = p2->pl_next)
00092             if (eq(wl->wl_word, p2->pl_typename))
00093                 break;
00094         if (!p2) {
00095             fprintf(cp_err, "Error: no such plot %s\n",
00096                     wl->wl_word);
00097             return;
00098         }
00099         wl = wl->wl_next;
00100     }
00101 
00102     /* Now do some tests to make sure these plots are really the
00103      * same type, etc.
00104      */
00105     if (!eq(p1->pl_name, p2->pl_name))
00106         fprintf(cp_err, 
00107         "Warning: plots %s and %s seem to be of different types\n",
00108             p1->pl_typename, p2->pl_typename);
00109     if (!eq(p1->pl_title, p2->pl_title))
00110         fprintf(cp_err, 
00111         "Warning: plots %s and %s seem to be from different circuits\n",
00112             p1->pl_typename, p2->pl_typename);
00113 
00114     /* This may not be the best way to do this */
00115     for (v1 = p1->pl_dvecs; v1; v1 = v1->v_next)
00116         v1->v_link2 = NULL;
00117     for (v2 = p2->pl_dvecs; v2; v2 = v2->v_next)
00118         v2->v_link2 = NULL;
00119 
00120     for (v1 = p1->pl_dvecs; v1; v1 = v1->v_next) {
00121         for (v2 = p2->pl_dvecs; v2; v2 = v2->v_next)
00122             if (!v2->v_link2 && nameeq(v1->v_name, v2->v_name) &&
00123                 ((v1->v_flags & (VF_REAL | VF_COMPLEX)) ==
00124                 (v2->v_flags & (VF_REAL | VF_COMPLEX))) &&
00125                 (v1->v_type == v2->v_type)) {
00126                 v1->v_link2 = v2;
00127                 v2->v_link2 = v1;
00128                 break;
00129             }
00130     }
00131 
00132     for (v1 = p1->pl_dvecs; v1; v1 = v1->v_next)
00133         if (!v1->v_link2)
00134             fprintf(cp_err, 
00135         ">>> %s vector %s in %s not in %s, or of wrong type\n",
00136                     isreal(v1) ? "real" : "complex",
00137                     v1->v_name, p1->pl_typename,
00138                     p2->pl_typename);
00139     for (v2 = p2->pl_dvecs; v2; v2 = v2->v_next)
00140         if (!v2->v_link2)
00141             fprintf(cp_err, 
00142         ">>> %s vector %s in %s not in %s, or of wrong type\n",
00143                     isreal(v2) ? "real" : "complex",
00144                     v2->v_name, p2->pl_typename,
00145                     p1->pl_typename);
00146 
00147     /* Throw out the ones that aren't in the arg list */
00148     if (wl && !eq(wl->wl_word, "all")) {    /* Just in case */
00149         for (v1 = p1->pl_dvecs; v1; v1 = v1->v_next)
00150             if (v1->v_link2) {
00151                 for (tw = wl; tw; tw = tw->wl_next)
00152                     if (nameeq(v1->v_name, tw->wl_word))
00153                         break;
00154                 if (!tw)
00155                     v1->v_link2 = NULL;
00156             }
00157         for (v2 = p2->pl_dvecs; v2; v2 = v2->v_next)
00158             if (v2->v_link2) {
00159                 for (tw = wl; tw; tw = tw->wl_next)
00160                     if (nameeq(v2->v_name, tw->wl_word))
00161                         break;
00162                 if (!tw)
00163                     v2->v_link2 = NULL;
00164             }
00165     }
00166     
00167     /* Now we have all the vectors linked to their twins.  Travel
00168      * down each one and print values that differ enough.
00169      */
00170     for (v1 = p1->pl_dvecs; v1; v1 = v1->v_next) {
00171         if (!v1->v_link2)
00172             continue;
00173         v2 = v1->v_link2;
00174         if (v1->v_type == SV_VOLTAGE)
00175             tol = vntol;
00176         else
00177             tol = abstol;
00178         j = MAX(v1->v_length, v2->v_length);
00179         for (i = 0; i < j; i++) {
00180             if (v1->v_length <= i) {
00181                 fprintf(cp_out, 
00182                 ">>> %s is %d long in %s and %d long in %s\n",
00183                         v1->v_name, v1->v_length,
00184                         p1->pl_typename, v2->v_length,
00185                         p2->pl_typename);
00186                 break;
00187             } else if (v2->v_length <= i) {
00188                 fprintf(cp_out, 
00189                 ">>> %s is %d long in %s and %d long in %s\n",
00190                         v2->v_name, v2->v_length,
00191                         p2->pl_typename, v1->v_length,
00192                         p1->pl_typename);
00193                 break;
00194             } else {
00195                 if (isreal(v1)) {
00196                     d1 = v1->v_realdata[i];
00197                     d2 = v2->v_realdata[i];
00198                     if (MAX(fabs(d1), fabs(d2)) * reltol +
00199                             tol < fabs(d1 - d2)) {
00200                                 printnum(numbuf, d1);
00201                         fprintf(cp_out,
00202                             "%s.%s[%d] = %-15s ",
00203                         p1->pl_typename, v1->v_name, i,
00204                         numbuf);
00205                         printnum(numbuf, d2);
00206                         fprintf(cp_out,
00207                             "%s.%s[%d] = %s\n",
00208                         p2->pl_typename, v2->v_name, i,
00209                         numbuf);
00210                     }
00211                 } else {
00212                     c1 = v1->v_compdata[i];
00213                     c2 = v2->v_compdata[i];
00214                     realpart(&c3) = realpart(&c1) - realpart(&c2);
00215                     imagpart(&c3) = imagpart(&c1) - imagpart(&c2);
00216                     /* Stupid evil PC compilers */
00217                     cm1 = cmag(&c1);
00218                     cm2 = cmag(&c2);
00219                     cmax = MAX(cm1, cm2);
00220                     if (cmax * reltol +
00221                             tol < cmag(&c3)) {
00222                         
00223                         printnum(numbuf,  realpart(&c1));
00224                         printnum(numbuf2, imagpart(&c1));
00225                         printnum(numbuf3, realpart(&c2));
00226                         printnum(numbuf4, imagpart(&c2));
00227                                 
00228                         fprintf(cp_out,
00229             "%s.%s[%d] = %-10s, %-10s %s.%s[%d] = %-10s, %s\n",
00230                         p1->pl_typename, v1->v_name, i,
00231                         numbuf,
00232                         numbuf2,
00233                         p2->pl_typename, v2->v_name, i,
00234                         numbuf3,
00235                         numbuf4);
00236                     }
00237                 }
00238             }
00239         }
00240     }
00241     return;
00242 }
